title: 103_hr670
content:
The "Family Planning Amendments Act of 1993" may be cited as the short title for this Act. Project grants and contracts for family planning services are addressed in this Act. The "Family Planning Amendments Act of 1993" requires family planning projects to provide pregnancy management information through qualified professionals holding specific degrees or meeting criteria determined by the Secretary. The "Family Planning Amendments Act of 1993" mandates that family planning projects offer pregnancy management information through qualified professionals or individuals permitted by State law. Projects or providers objecting on religious or moral grounds are not obligated to provide such information but must refer individuals to alternative sources. Information includes nondirective counseling and referrals on pregnancy management options. The "Family Planning Amendments Act of 1993" requires family planning projects to offer pregnancy management information, including counseling and referrals on prenatal care, infant care, adoption, and termination of pregnancy. Entities performing abortions must comply with state laws on parental notification and consent to receive grants or contracts under the Public Health Service Act. The "Family Planning Amendments Act of 1993" requires family planning projects to offer pregnancy management information, including counseling and referrals on prenatal care, infant care, adoption, and termination of pregnancy. States can enforce parental notification or consent laws for abortions on minors. The Secretary may only award grants for family planning projects that distribute FDA-approved condoms for pregnancy and STD prevention. The "Family Planning Amendments Act of 1993" requires family planning projects to offer pregnancy management information, including counseling on prenatal care, infant care, adoption, and termination of pregnancy. Grants and contracts under this section are authorized to be appropriated $220,000,000 for fiscal year 1994, and $250,000,000 for fiscal year 1995. SEC. 3. Authorization of appropriations for training grants and contracts: Amends Section 1003(b) of the Public Health Service Act to authorize $6,250,000 for fiscal year 1994 and $7,000,000 for fiscal year 1995 for grants and contracts under subsection (a).

SEC. 4. Authorization of appropriations for informational and educational materials: Amends Section 1005(b) of the Public Health Service Act to authorize $12,000,000 for fiscal year 1994 and $13,500,000 for fiscal year 1995 for grants and contracts under subsection (a).

SEC. 5. Sense of Congress; Requirement regarding notice. SEC. 5. Sense of Congress; Requirement regarding notice. In the case of equipment or products authorized for purchase with grants or contracts under title X of the Public Health Service Act, Congress urges recipients to buy American-made items. The Secretary of Health and Human Services must notify award recipients about this requirement. Passed the House of Representatives on March 25, 1993.
